result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raheem K Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raheem K Miller appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Defendant needs to contact SPD and go to the CJF to be booked. Case is passed until 1:30 PM.

***
Recalled at 1:41 PM. Defendant Raheem K Miller appeared by video.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Raheem K Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brett Copeland will be taking this case. Court vacates warrant previously issued. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raheem K Miller not in court.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Defendant failed to be booked and released by October 14th, 2022 at 5:00pm. Court took no action as to bail.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-14-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Raheem K Miller in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/12/22 @ 1:30p
